definition: descriptive geometry (three-dimensional geometry using projections and elevations)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The thesis first came up with a problem in projective geometry.
sentences.chinese: 本文首先給出了一道畫法幾何題。

sentences.english: The suggested one is more effective for drawing generation of questions in descriptive geometry.
sentences.chinese: 這一方法有助於提高求解畫法幾何問題的作圖效率。

sentences.english: This method may extend the field of solving problems on the descriptive geometry.
sentences.chinese: 它可以擴大畫法幾何的解題範圍。

sentences.english: Finally the paper expounded on the basis of the theory of descriptive geometry about two ways.
sentences.chinese: 並闡述了這兩種作圖方法的畫法幾何理論依據。
